website_summaries.verdict: This emergency radio offers excellent performance at a budget-friendly price.
pros: Can serve as an emergency radio, table lamp, and flashlight
Features a rechargeable battery that delivers up to 12 hours of light or 6 hours of radio time
Comes with an SOS alarm with flashing light to help you notify or warn others about an emergency
Equipped with an indicator light to show when the radio is charging or fully charged
cons: Radio sometimes won't hold a charge
Knob tends to snap off the radio easily

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Uses 3 Triple AAA Batteries which is ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Uses 3 Triple AAA Batteries which is a nice touch. Also USB NiCad Battery Charging. Plus Solar and Crank. Better made and larger than some of the other models on Amazon. Just had a storm and power outage last week, so this will come in handy the next time. Weather Band is pretty boring until a storm comes but it is handy when you need it. The reading light and adjustable falshlight is a nice touch. Update: Hurricane Matthew! No power for 5 days. This radio was a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Wy Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a radio that would charge during the day and play at night...not so much. After charging over 10 hours in the Arizona Sun, it plays on the solar battery for about 20 minutes, sometimes less. When using AAA batteries, it might last a couple hours, but then those batteries are also dead. Additionally, I get no weather stations at all. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Brummett

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was a really good product but one trip to the outdoors and the frequency number piece of plastic was all warped and coming away from the product because it was in the sun! It's solar powered so this is not acceptable. Everything else worked.
customer_reviews.author: nyoka williams

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Many Weather Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: As a survivor of Hurricane Irma in SW Florida, I fortunately never lost power or communication. I can enthusiastically give this 5 stars partly because it gave me such a sense of security. I kept it by my side waiting for the storm to hit, knowing that in most circumstances, this would let me cope, at least temporarily, with power loss and communication. I tested each of its features and it functions as described. Since many of my neighbors are still waiting for power after 8 days, I can appreciate being able to charge the battery with a solar panel. It comes with basic instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie P.J.

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out, we'll worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Can fit in the palm of your hand Red indicator light when charging, green when fully charged Picks up a lot of radio stations AM and FM Also picks up several weather stations Audio is good LED reading light and flashlight very bright I like the way the antenna collapses and goes inside unit to protect it Use of AAA batteries a plus Better than the red cross ones Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Todd F. FAIR, HONEST REVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: This product is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is a waste of money, the radio and light are the only features that work. The solar portion and charging port did not work on the product I received even with batteries leaving me stranded with a dead phone and no way to charge it. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Thurman

customer_reviews.title: Broken Knob within 5 Weeks - Can't Return this Fragile Product
customer_reviews.text: The charger crank knob broke off after only minimal to moderate usage in the first 5 weeks of ownership. Instead of "emergency ready" or "survival preparedness" I would use the word "fragile" to describe it's quality. Extremely disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: AM STATIONS DO NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: AM stations do not work at all, which is the only stations i want to listen to during tornado warnings. Short return window and can no longer return it. Would not recommend this radio to anyone that actually wants to stay informed during emergency situations.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfclover

customer_reviews.title: Good full featured radio with weak FM tuning
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put in an emergency kit. The device works well except for the FM radio. It's difficult to tune in any but the most powerful channels which is frustrating. (Channels I can get perfectly fine on a shower radio in the same location won't tune in on this device.) Fortunately that shouldn't be an issue in an emergency as I'll probably be listening to the weather band but it's something to note anyway. Otherwise the device is good and I don't regret my purchase. I didn't see any other devices in this price range with a similar range of functionality so given the same choices, I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: not very well made. Wasn't long before crank handle ...
customer_reviews.text: not very well made. Wasn't long before crank handle grip fell off....followed very closely by the antenna. The battery contacts (spring looking) move so I have to gently lift them back up so contact can be made. Had difficulty adjusting dial to bring in a radio station & the dial does not match where the radio channel should be. The solar panel doesn't recharge the radio, and the crank doesn't keep the radio going for very long at all. The instructions are very lacking. Bought the product protection policy, but could not figure out how to apply for repair/replacement....that too was not clear.
customer_reviews.author: F. Eckermann

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable. Stopped working after couple weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Radio started out working fine with solar or hand crank. After a couple weeks of light use does not hold a charge. Not reliable or suited for emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a pro during Hurricane Irma!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this during Hurricane Irma, it was a life saver! Our power went out this past Monday and stayed out until Thursday evening. As the storm raged outside, this radio provided clear and sorely needed updates. I never had to use the crank, the solar battery alone handled the load. Between this and a couple of solar powered flashlights I purchased we ended up in pretty good shape. Charging this device is easy - I simply sit it in a window in my man cave and let it catch the rays. Trust me, this works, and not because I think or hope it will - it's because during a hurricane it actually did!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Williams

customer_reviews.title: Compact and thoughtfully designed
customer_reviews.text: I had an emergency radio of this type for years that finally deteriorated. No amount of cranking would bring it back to life. Searching for a replacement, I discovered this one by Running Snail and decided it was the perfect upgrade for me. I like having the choice of battery back-up, crank, and solar. Saw a few comments about weak radio reception and I experienced that too until I popped up the antenna. Came through loud and clear. Tested all the features and they worked fine. It's a handy addition to my work station as it takes up so little space and if the power goes out again, I'll feel smug about being prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Lovisa

customer_reviews.title: was happy because Hurricane Irma was about to hit
customer_reviews.text: [OLD REVIEW] Got it, was happy because Hurricane Irma was about to hit. The flashlight adjuster on the front fell off, it doesn't hold a charge, and doesn't charge anything connected to it. the only thing it does good, is well play the radio, until the charge it doesn't have fizzles out. Cranking does nothing. The light comes on, but even after 30 mins of cranking, you get nothing but more headache, and no charge. [UPDATE] So they contacted me and were willing to send me a new one, so lets see if this new one will work, but because they were kind enough to respond to me and try to work this out, I changed my review.
customer_reviews.author: Cayla

customer_reviews.title: Return
customer_reviews.text: I would like to return this item. This radio has fallen short on quality and performance. The sound disappear and fades and you have slap the radio. It is not a good radio for me.. I should have returned it before now. October 26 I need to return this radio. I love radio. Music ,talk, sports and what ever best way to travel. I would shoot Marconi over this piece of radio. It is the worst. It will not even play as I said above its even worst now. Please let me return this thing called Snail. I detest it and want to replace it anything. Thank you Bill Worrell
customer_reviews.author: Bongo in TN

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. You never know when you're going to need it, but you'll be glad you have it if you do.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little radio/charger. I bought this after I helped family in Florida through a hurricane and understood the value of having a standalone, portable radio available for news. It saw a lot of action here at home when the wildfires blasted through the area and the subsequent mudslides washed away all our cell, telephone, cable tv and internet services, leaving us only with radio. This was our sole link to the world and it did a great job. It's much smaller than you'd think from the picture, but it has a decent volume and it does what it needs to do. Tuning was simple and we experienced no problems with the unit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey W. Larvenz

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I had read the other reviews and was hesitant, but tried it anyway as I have Prime and Amazon is very good about returns. I live on the Gulf and having had power outages and hurricanes, this little radio will be fine. The stations are limited but audio is clear, solar light works fine, and that is all I really need. I bought KMASHI 10000mAh Portable Power Bank with Dual USB Ports 3.1A Output and 2A Input for my cell phone 3 years ago and that works great and can be charged up with USB in your car outlet which will last for a few days on one charge.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Radio Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Radio just stopped working. Charge and other power sources do not work. Very disappointing. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The radio was great and I was able to charge my phone
customer_reviews.text: When a strong tropical storm passed through we lost power for a while. The radio was great and I was able to charge my phone. Though it does not charge fast, it does work well. I was able to make several calls. The flashlight is bright and the reading is good too. Overall, the quality is much better than similar products I've owned in the past.
customer_reviews.author: alilu

customer_reviews.title: We used these during hurricane Irma and they were fantastic. They charged even under cloudy skies
customer_reviews.text: We used these during hurricane Irma and they were fantastic. They charged even under cloudy skies, provided clear reception and kept our cell phones charged. Even my gadget crazy son was impressed. Thanks for a great product at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Phillips

customer_reviews.title: FOUR ways to power this emergency radio!
customer_reviews.text: This radio is not something you would listen to for fantastic sound. It works well. I can get all the stations they advertise they can get plus lots of local stations. Due to the variety of power options it is the perfect radio for off the grid and emergency situations. You can use sun if you have it, lithium batteries can be charged using the solar, regular batteries if you have them, other devices can be charged and if all else fails you can wind it up (which will take a while). All in all the perfect emergency radio. A great deal too.
customer_reviews.author: Ladibug

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely not worth your time or money. I am not sure if I received a defective product or this is just true for all. Just got back from a camping trip and prior to leaving had fully charged device to serve as a back battery charger well hiking. It could only manage to charge my phone 5% before dying. Thought the solar panel would charge it enough to help, wrong. Definitely better off buying a different product. Wish I could return but a week too late and now stuck with this garbage I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: It works like it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: It feels sturdy enough. The solar panel works pretty good for charging, 6-8 hours in sunlight, pretty typical. The sound is just OK, the antenna is a bit short, but the flashlight is very good. The hand crank feels reliable and strong enough to work. But I prefer the Craftsman rechargeable portable weather radio. It has all of the same features but with a much longer antenna which gives you a stronger signal and better sound quality. Its flashlight isn't quite as good but good enough. And they are about the same size. But the Craftsman is a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dascoli

customer_reviews.title: I keep it in the sunshine when I'm not using it and a good charge lasted over a day
customer_reviews.text: It isn't a thousand dollar stereo system but it sounds okay. I picked up several stations in a mountain area where it's difficult to get anything. I keep it in the sunshine when I'm not using it and a good charge lasted over a day...radio only. Haven't tried the phone charger. Single light is adequate, table light much better. Weather station reception poor where I was...but that is normal for that locale. Size is perfect...antenna site is too funny...had to look for it. Switching from AAA batteries to charged batteries is a benefit. Cranked easily...only used the crank a short time. I like this very much.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: when us wing the SOS mode, this device sounds an ear peircing siren. There's no notes about this in the product description or specifications. This option should be switchable. I'm returning this device because the flashlight does not work. Also, tuning the analog radio is very difficult. AM function could not produce any usable reception. I would only be moderately pleased with this purchase if everything worked...
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Tisdale

customer_reviews.title: Good ideas, build issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking little unit. Easy to use & had good reception. The first I got had an antenna that wouldn't stand up. The volume/on-off switch didn't always work. Returned it for exchange for another unit. The switch was good on the replacement, but the antenna had the same issue. Lots of good ideas in the unit...the hand generator was very solid & smooth. Flashlight was quite bright enough for emergency situations. The reading one was good & would light up a room well enough to accomplish most anything. Would loved to have kept it, but after two with the same antenna issue I chose to go with a different brand is had in the past & had good service from.
customer_reviews.author: The Frog

customer_reviews.title: Cannot charge lithium battery
customer_reviews.text: Cannot charge lithium battery. I switched the button to Li-Ion and tried using the hand crank for 5 minutes as the manual states. I also had the switch toggled to charging mode for this. The red charging light comes on but it does not seem to actually charge the battery as the radio will only work while cranking vigorously. The red charging light comes on while plugged into usb but that also doesnt seem to charge the battery. Will likely return unless its miraculously comes to life soon.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Eby

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Great little device for your needs! Both the flashlight & light bar work great, radio has a wide range and easy to operate, and multiple ways to get a charge. The original one I got had a faulty Li-Ion battery that didn't hold a charge, but I emailed their help center which was on a note in the box and they immediately sent me a replacement free-of-charge! Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Just threw mine in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok a few times, but slowly started working less and less. Got to where it wouldn't work on Battery power at ALL, barely with full sun, and really only worked after you cranked it --- and even then it would stay in tune for maybe 3-5 minutes and then the station would turn to static. I would have to turn it off and back on again to get another 3-5 minutes of use. So strange!!
customer_reviews.author: MateasMom

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid and Dependable Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nice solid, dependable emergency radio. Between the solar and crank charging options, i have never had to rely on batteries, other then the rechargeable that came with the radio. The reading light, and flashlight options have actually come in fairly handy. The radio has picked up the stations i want to hear, and has a good sound. Now keep in mind, its a small radio, so expect small speaker sound quality. For the size of the speaker, I am impressed with the sound quality of talk and music stations. It was better then I thought it would be. I am very pleased with this radio, and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyG

customer_reviews.title: Antenna broke immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the high ratings. Opened it up and pulled out the antenna and it broke immediately? Poor design ......then I opened the battery compartment and the plastic tab at top almost broke so l tried to close it and it didn't close or click back into place. Disappointed the quality was so poor. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio for my husband last Christmas (2017). He had it for about a month when the antenna fell off. My husband is super picky about how his things are taken care of. We sent the radio back for a replacement. He has rarely used the replacement. Just recently the replacement antenna fell off. Again. The radio will NOT work at all. Total waste of money. I would greatly appreciate it if someone from Running Snail would contact us.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Works well! Instructions need updated.
customer_reviews.text: Replacement worked fine, company should update instructions to match product and would avoid a lot of confusion. Happy with product now and glad to have for when power goes down. Customer service was also very good in reaching to make sure I was taken care of and offered to remedy any issue that was still active. I told them all is good now. Out of box and charging... charge light was solid and not flashing as indicated in instruction. After a few hours it turned to green and radio, SOS, Top Flood worked, but flash light would not come when depressing the power button. Returning for exchange and will update review when arrives.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cordell

customer_reviews.title: Day 3: not working
customer_reviews.text: Day 3 and not working. Not holding a charge after cranking the handle. Severely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: shelly r garcia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The battery is a 2000 mAh as advertised. The radio works great, Sound quality is not very good. But it has one speaker that is very underpowered. So understandable. It does charge smaller smartphones, but they need to be powered off to charge well. Water resistance is minimal. Just taking the battery out, you can see there are no water proofing measures taken. So keep it out of the rain! I am satisfied with the purchase, and recommend at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: Sux
customer_reviews.text: All I can say I s if you need exercise this is your radio. It will not recharge via usb or solar so crank away. 1 Dec 2018: I received a new radio from the seller based on my previous review so a big thank you to them! The new radio works great; it charges well by solar, crank or usb and it works well as a flashlight or reading lamp and as an emergency radio it has good reception on the weather band. I'm still only going to give it 3 stars because there should be better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I received an unit where the charge LED did not turn green after charging overnight. I contacted RunningSnail and after a few emails, they promptly sent a replacement which works. They did initially ask for a video of the problem which I can understand so that customers don't take advantage of them. But I did not have time to go through all of that. I did send a photo and that seemed to satisfy them. Otherwise i would have just returned the unit through Amazon. The radio itself seems to work fine and meets expectations for a small, inexpensive emergency radio.
customer_reviews.author: Caleecs

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: We use this every day. It stays in the bathroom, on the counter, in mild sun. For the first month, it held a charge great. Run the crank part 10 times, and you were good for a week at 30 min per run. After the first month, you give it 10-15 cranks, and it last for 15 min. This quick degradation has been a real let down, and I would NOT want this in the emergency pack in the garage. Update Company reached out to me and took care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbvi

customer_reviews.title: Its a sweet little radio
customer_reviews.text: Works fully as intended. The battery life is insanely long. I have used it at the beach and on a boat for days just on the factory charge lol. The only issue is that the antenna is rusting already just for being in the salty air on the beach. Update: 2-17-2020 I have used this radio for a while now ALOT. Usually 2-8 hours in a stretch. It is still running on the factory charge!!! I have not had to recharge this radio or even crank it. It does a great job of maintaining charge through the solar panel it seems. I now have above a hundred hours of use and still have not had to charge it!
customer_reviews.author: Zosma

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our Emergency Kit!
customer_reviews.text: The RunningSnail Solar Crank NOAA Weather Radio is a great addition to our emergency kit! I've had it for a few months now and take it out every so often to charge it up and listen to some tunes. I can't verify if the solar piece actually charges the radio as I have charged via the hand-crank every time I've used the radio. The reception is great especially since we live in the country! The flashlight is bright enough, but I've never had to use it, nor would use it unless it was a last resort. And honestly I really love the green color!
customer_reviews.author: Stephany Geiger

customer_reviews.title: Radio stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in case of an emergency and just took it out of the box to perform a check and to recharge the battery. Looks like the radio stopped working. I can only hear the hum from the speaker but none of the radio stations get tuned. Either FM or AM. What is the point of having this radio if it does not work. Very disappointed with it. Although the overall finish and the light are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: parvata

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio for close to three years. Still, never had to use it, so nearly right out of the box, new. Tonight I really need the weather radio, and the speaker is not working. Everything else is fine. But, I was really hoped I could rely on this when I needed it. I've tried everything and the speaker will not play for ANY function. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AJW

customer_reviews.title: Great thing to have for any situation
customer_reviews.text: If youre a doomsday prepper or a survivalist this is a must have! Great for emergencies becuase of all the radio frequesncies it has. Water resistance it always nice incase of a natural disater. The crank is a great feature so you dont have to worry about batteries and the ability to charge your phone or any device is great. Solar option as well as a flash light makes this a must have in any home/car/boat/camping trip
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Is The Best Weather Radio I've Ever Used! Thank You!
customer_reviews.text: This item has many different features which I find very helpful. I love that it has a solar panel and can charge devices. Additionally, the flashlight and alarm are great features too and I also love that although you can use batteries that you have other options for charging this. I've always loved having a crank feature as well as this being a portable size particularly for power outages plus having the warranty and additional insurance offered is great. I will be getting another one of these in the future if I need too. Thank you RunningSnail!
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn

customer_reviews.title: fantastic for our hurricane kit
customer_reviews.text: the weather radio got a good signal from 3 hours to our nearest reporting station. We used the winding charger constantly for 4 days during hurricane Florence in 2018 during our power outage. It was great to have some information from the outside world even though the antenna broke during the second day. The flashlight was bright, although we didn't use it much. we also didn't test the water resistance ability. the wrist strap was great for hanging it up away from kids and in a place where we all could hear well even from a different room. The speakers are nice and loud as well. I gave it a four star because of the weak antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Brown

customer_reviews.title: Can not tune a single FM or WB station ... barely gets an AM station
customer_reviews.text: I can't tune a single FM radio station on it, nor can I get a single weather band station. I can BARELY pick up a very faint AM station. It can't be due to where I live - about 20 miles outside NYC - we have tons of stations in the area that I can pick up on $5 radios ... but not on this $30 radio. Not sure if I received a defective unit or what, but very dissatisfied with the purchase. Unfortunately I bought it for my go-bag and did not test it in the first month I had it, so I'm only now realizing it six months later.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Thomerson

customer_reviews.title: Small but packs a punch.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this emergency crank radio to replace one I had for about a decade. When I looked at the product I mistakenly didn't see its size and was initially disappointed when I received it. However, I was very wrong in judging it initially. The flashlight is has a very bright LED and the top light, underneath the solar panel, can easily light up a 10 x 10 room. The radio is solid and can pick up most FM/AM stations. It also is built tough with a hard plastic frame. I definitely recommend this for anyone needed an emergency radio or is going camping.
customer_reviews.author: N.P.

customer_reviews.title: Emergency radio/backup phone charger
customer_reviews.text: Bought for emergency use. It feels kind of cheap but it is very lightweight. Instructions could be a little more helpful. We think it will work fine for emergency use. Adapter included for iPhone does not fit but we can use our normal iPhone charging cord. The least bit of light has the charging light on but putting your hand over the solar panel turns off the charging indicator. Sound quality not great but not really intended for leisure listening. Overall, happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was really disappointed in the actual product after reading all the rave reviews. We live in a largish metropolitan suburb, and I had the radio couldn't pick up the strongest of local FM stations. And if I got a station to tune in, it wouldn't last when the radio was moved from one side of the room to the other. I did test the solar battery, and it seemed to work well, as did the flashlight (which was quite bright), but the last of clear radio reception means I'm sending this one back.
customer_reviews.author: Badger Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad unit, needs some work though!
customer_reviews.text: Was going to return it but past the window to do so, the unit is not bad but the lithium ion battery system leaves much to be desired, after leaving it in the sunlight for a few days I only got about an hour worth of radio time off of it before it died. The lights on the unit will always choose the AAA batteries over Lion depleting them without you knowing it, would have rather had the battery selector switch have a 3 way with auto added in and the other 2 be that battery selected ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: Arcfire

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Tool
customer_reviews.text: For years we wanted one. The hand crank (per manual) says 1 min of cranking gives 10-15 minutes of battery life. The SOS noise I guess would be helpful if we needed it. The light is decently bright, the volume is VERY loud. The antenna could be a bit stealthy yet it’s understood this was not built for that, it’s light enough and has a strap with a carabiner. We attached the charging cord to the strap. It came with an Apple adapter so you can charge androids or apples off of it. I haven’t used (depended) on it yet I feel it’s going to do very good
customer_reviews.author: Pineiro Family

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Radio with Lots of Features
customer_reviews.text: Never had a radio before (only cassette players, CD players and iPods) and this radio is really really good. Not only it can be charged with the small solar panel, but it also has the hand crank handle as well as you can add up AAA batteries for it to work. It has so many features that it makes it more than just a radio. Both the flashlight and the reading lamp work perfectly. It has a feature to make an emergency sound in case you get lost in the woods or you want to call the attention of an emergency rescue. Comes with a strap wich is pretty handy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: All around everything I want in a radio...
customer_reviews.text: AM/FM/Weather, flashlight, solar power, USB and power, I got it to stay in communicado with the outside world in case everything goes dark. I got it for my office. When our electricity went out, we didn't know how long it would be or what had happened. This way in case we have a major outage we will know what is going on. During the 2011 Tsunami, we were waiting for the Tsunami to come in (I am 350 ft up in the air) and the radio station was on top of it. National television was about a half hour behind reporting on the progress of the Tsunami. Radio is definitely the way to go in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: jmr13

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Like a few other reviews, the radio is a little smaller than expected; but it sounds clear enough and it works as an emergency radio. Charged it via micro usb, haven't had a chance to charge using the crank. Only potential issue is that it has an internal battery that's not replaceable and I feel like other batteries it will go bad over time leading it to possibly stop being able to hold a charge and become unstable. As long as the unit lasts more than 3 years I'll be happy in that this wasn't a expensive radio to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Gelo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for work. We are adding it to our emergency supplies. I tested it and it works well only a few hand Cranks and it works
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Flores

customer_reviews.title: Cute with so much potential
customer_reviews.text: Upon unpacking the radio the first thing I thought was “oh how cute” seriously it’s tiny, but what potential! I cranked it for a few seconds and set it to a radio station in seconds. It also has a super bright light I managed to blind myself with immediately while pushing all random buttons to explore my new toys different options. We got it during a flash deal for 25 bucks and since we live in Florida obviously had to add it to our emergency kit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential emergency radio!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for our emergency go bag in 2017 and was finally forced to use it in our recent Northern California emergency power shut offs. This was by far the most useful item and I’m so glad we had it - one thing that nobody tells you is that when the power goes out, often cell towers are down. This radio was our only link to the outside world and kept us apprised of wildfire status, evacuations etc. We had great reception and the battery was barely used despite constant use over multiple days (I assume because we left it outside to charge). I am recommending it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, features and price
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product 5 stars but the crank feature to charge your cell phone was extremely show and painful for someone with arthritis. Sound and reception of radio was ok. This is a replacement for a older unit that lasted more than 15 years but did not have many of the features this one has.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work correctly in AAA backup battery mode
customer_reviews.text: I returned my unit because of defect in AAA battery mode. Only the flashlight worked, not the Radio nor the SOS mode. I got confirmation from another Amazon customer that ALL functions should work on either battery mode before I sent the product back. Too bad, as it is a handy little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Kells

customer_reviews.title: wonderful and disappointing both
customer_reviews.text: wonderful and disappointing both. This compact little radio is a delight. I get decent reception, and it's easy to crank up. Others have complained that it is small; I like that it fits easily in my hand...but one of main features I wanted--the reading light--quit working two days after I got it. Have read all directions, tried in in all modes. Oh, well, I think it's a great design but then made in China on the cheap.
customer_reviews.author: susanusha

customer_reviews.title: This is the emergency radio you want during an emergency
customer_reviews.text: This radio is superb. It has multiple power options: solar, usb, lithium ion, AA, hand crank. It works flawlessly. It's compact in size but also distributes sound loud enough to hear from farr away. It also has a bright light. This is the radio I keep in a bag for emergencies for my family. I can't say enough about it. I also had a couple questions that I sent to the manufacturer and they answered super fast and prompt. Their customer support is impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: UserUnnamed

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to add to our Emergency Kit. I love everything about it except the stations that it could catch (or stations it couldn't catch). I love all of the features that it comes with because those are the little things that I don't think of that could and will help when in time of need. I totally recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a radio to add to their Emergency Kit. I haven't had the chance to test it's resistance to water yet, therefor I could not give it a 5 star rating in that category.
customer_reviews.author: L.R.D

customer_reviews.title: A must for hurricane zones.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this radio just before Hurricane Harvey hit Corpus Christi. We were then without power for a week afterward, and this little radio was VERY handy. The solar charging is not fast but reliable, the radio signal is clear for the size of the antenna, and the two types of light offered helped a lot around a dark and boarded-up house. It was some of the best money we spent in preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Knioum

customer_reviews.title: The most versatile item I have bought after Hurricane Maria
customer_reviews.text: It's a flashlight, it's a table lamp, it's a AM/FM/WB radio with very good reception (antenna hides inside), its a phone charger and you can plug in a USB operated small fan, and it also has an SOS emergency siren with flashing red light in case you need it. It uses AAA batteries OR you can charge it via solar, hand crank, power outlet or USB (car, power bank etc). It's compact (fits in the palm of my hand) and cute (yes, I'm a girl! LOL). A must have for camping, power outages and yes, natural disasters.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Work great right out of the box after I put AAA batteries in it. Being here in Oregon I’m using what little non-liquid sunshine we have available and see how it charges up, so far the red light stayed on which I assume means it’s charging with the solar panel.I’ve had an eton fr160, but lately it’s only been periodically working. The snail has all the features and qualities I was looking for. Too bad Amazon didn’t highlight if I would’ve bought to the time I would’ve got a discount on the second one since I will probably buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: cautious 1

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It pretty much has everything you need in case of an emergency. Sound quality is not the best but enough. Batter life, depends how much you use but good thing is it has a manual crank charger so you don't really need to have extra battery all the time. Splash tested but not submerged (scared)
customer_reviews.author: GeEmWae8

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: The reading light and flashlight I use most often, it is better than the other multi function radio's I have used. I have not used the cell phone charger feature ,yet and one of the flaws in design is there is no storage space for the charging cord. Another feature that would be nice is a clock. However, I will be purchasing this product for Christmas gifts for my entire family.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Alton K. Easton, PhD

customer_reviews.title: East batteries like a glutton
customer_reviews.text: Find a better portable radios somewhere else. Reasons why? 1. This unit has poor to just OK sound. 2. worst of all, it eats batteries like no other device I own. Replace almost once every 1-2 weeks and that's just with occasional use. 3. In the battery storage area, one of the contact point (spiral) broke so there is no contact, and thus doesn't work even with fresh batteries. Lithium Ion battery will charge in the sun but doesn't last that long. Good feature for a battery hogging radio. I wanted to like this unit but it's been a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: Good Radio, doesn't really keep a charge.
customer_reviews.text: This stopped charging with the sun, then when I tried to plug the USB charger, the smaller end of the charger in, it busted off and went inside the radio. Now, I am unable to charge it with the smaller end of the USB cord.
customer_reviews.author: Connie R Ames

customer_reviews.title: AAA Power Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: The AAA power stopped working. Just plain dead. However does work when switched over to crank power. Radio tuning is touchy and the display is next to useless. Will be getting another unit that either has a larger tuning display or a digital display. All in all, can't recommend for an emergency radio as the AAA power stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moore III

customer_reviews.title: Good for your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted to buy a weather radio for a while but I kept putting it off. I bought this one thinking it would be one that would alert me to weather issues in my area but it’s not. It will broadcast NOAA and the alerts if you have it on, but not sound an alert when you are sleeping which is what I thought it would do. Anyway, it charged very quickly and the flashlight is very bright. It seems to pick up NOAA in my area clearly. I am going to keep it because it could come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Willis

customer_reviews.title: We were thankful to have this during hurricane sally
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We just went through a hurricane and it helped us to get updates after power outage 4 days of no power). It also charged my phone several times. Battery life was great! Never had to use the solar or crank. Antenna isn't fantastic, but we were able to pick up a few local stations on FM radio. Now that the storm is gone, it still didn't pick up all radio stations...but in a crises, it saved us.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: The hand crank is the best feature of this device on how you can power ...
customer_reviews.text: Something that everyone should have, not just for emergencies, but to charge up your cell phone when you run out of juice. Radio functions perfectly and receives all the stations that my car does. The flashlight isn't the brightest, but could work in a pinch. The siren is a loud one, so be careful! The hand crank is the best feature of this device on how you can power the unit itself, or power other devices via the usb ports.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Parker

customer_reviews.title: needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: This radio was used during hurricane Irma. ( Florida resident here ). So the good and the bad The good. 1. FM reception was great. Was able to get an excellent, clear signal from a station. 2. Flashlight and charger worked fine. The bad. 1. Unable to receive a signal from NOAA stations, just static. I am well within range of 2 NOAA weather stations. 2 This is minor, but the battery compartment needed a bit of fidgeting to get it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Peep

customer_reviews.title: Faulty reading light
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Sound quality is good. - Supports both AAA batteries and a built-in lithium ion battery - Multiple charging options (usb, solar, hand-crank) - AM+FM+NOAA radio bands Cons: - Broken reading light Main reason for giving it 2 stars is that the reading light broke within 5 seconds of using it. I tried charging it but it didn't fix it. I've seen other reviews with the same issue so it sounds like some units are defective. You can see in the attached video that the reading light doesn't work while the standard flashlight works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Stogaitis

customer_reviews.title: I love this radio!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this radio for 2 years now.(We live in the backwoods of the Ozarks)Through 2 storm seasons..Winter power outages...Friday night high school football games...Out in the garden... I love it! Even bought one for my neighbor.because everything is so unpredictable down here..except for this little radio.Flashlight.Solar.Battery.Crank charge.Just get one.We are old..this is high tech enough for us!
customer_reviews.author: OzarksRN

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I toss these in every b.o.b. I make for friends and family and not one has broken down now after months of use and repeated use. I am so glad I found these. I do suggest getting familiar with them before putting them to use in the field because they have multiple uses and there is a siren feature that is not at all soft, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Nice little radio system.
customer_reviews.text: Nice features for the price. Radio signal is a little weak but otherwise it seems to be a great emergency radio. Built in flashlight is alright, but the built in flood light is pretty bright. Charge it up by plugging it in or cranking it. Solar panel helps to maintain longer battery life, does not really charge it. Allows for AAA battery backup as well in case you haven't charged it in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Luckily I haven't needed it but its great to have. Really well thought out design so many ways to charge it. Im sure it would be a great beach tag-a-long or if you were to go camping. It gives me peace of mind that in the event of a major power outage I'd have some light and a way to get some info. I've only crank charged it and was able to listen to the radio for a good bit of time. The flash light works and the larger light.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: This is also good to use daily and not just as a emergancy item.
customer_reviews.text: Very good radio reception even NOA, night light plenty bright and wide coverage. Siren and red flashing light ok, rechargeable battery life good if used wisely, being able to use AAA if you want or need is a bonus for even longer use, and when all else is used up the crank works well for short use periods. I do like this item very much but the flash light would be nice if it were a little brighter and wider range of focus and a small storage area for the cord and adapter would be great so you don't have to fumble around to find it when you need it and that's if it doesn't get lost first.
customer_reviews.author: David  H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little radio to move around with you while cleaning. I live in a very difficult area for reception on anything antenna radio, cell phones and tv antennas so I was nicely surprised to find the reception to be just fine. At this time I'm unsure about battery life as it has not been necessary.
customer_reviews.author: NOF

customer_reviews.title: Updated: 11/21/2019 - Received a Replacement Radio
customer_reviews.text: Updated 11/21/2019 - the RunningSnail company was very good to deal with. They saw my previous review, below, and quickly sent me a replacement radio. I charged it today and maybe I need to remember to keep the radio in use and charged. Previously I only use it during a trip to the coast for weather reports. Thank you RunningSnail for being a company I can rely on. Previous review: I ordered this last Octobere 2018. Used it on a trip last fall. today I tried using it, dead, I changed the batteries still dead....nothing. No FM No AM and NO WEATHER BAND!!
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Handy in case of emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for emergencies. Always have an emergency kit handy, and this is an essential tool to keep with you. The volume on the radio is pretty loud. There is a forward facing torch and a reading light under the solar panel. Hand crank can charge a usb powered device in a no power situation. The SOS function can help with an audio and visual distress signal. My only complaints about this item, is that it is only water resistant, not waterproof, and that there is no compartment for holding spare charging cables.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Nabor

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for my emergency survival kit. It has definitely exceeded my expectations! I have not tried it with AAA batteries, only with the crank and solar panel: It’s small, but surprisingly powerful - picks up WB, FM, and AM even without the antenna extended, the flashlight is adequate, reading lamp is small but quite bright, I accidentally activated the alarm - it’s VERY loud (scared the bejeebers out of me). The box has a sticker that says “Awesome”. I have to agree! I’m very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: 🐝

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile device! Lightning adapter only thing that did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Great little device. Arrived charged and had good reception on Weather and FM bands, improved by extending the antennae. Flashlight has focus ring to change beam width. Red light indicates when charging by crank, solar, or micro USB. Does have a little electronic smell when charging - hopefully not a fire risk. Switch on bottom enables loud SOS or phone charging via USB outlet. Only thing that did not work is included micro-USB-to-Apple Lightning adapter, so be sure to pack your own cable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom who lives in Puerto Rico and is still without power after Hurricane Maria. This has been a true blessing! It is so convenient, no need to worry about batteries, simply leave it outside for a couple of hours and let the sun do its thing, solar panel, or crank it for a few minutes. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Radelys Comas

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: Died after 2 months. Got small shock then burning smell ... static on all bands. Asked seller for replacement ... nothing, but obstacles/hassle for a week ... gave up. Company finally sent replacement which lasted about 6 months before it started to fail .... poor reception, would drift of frequency setting, or just stop receiving, batteries lasted about a week when only used infrequently. Finally gave up and ordered a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: BreezDog

customer_reviews.title: Nice little radio
customer_reviews.text: Just received this little radio, used the handcrank for a few minutes and was impressed with how well it worked! Good value, hopefully it will work well if ever true emergency. Not sure I would trust the attached carry handle to hold up if hanging from a backpack and will probably try to find leather carry case....
customer_reviews.author: Mikey P & Nana

customer_reviews.title: Very cool - LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Living with unknown frequent power outages in California, prompted me to buy something that would keep in touch with the world when even wireless systems are down. I charged this cool little radio with the solar charging ability. It worked!!! It's got everything you need for a very low cost to stay connected to the world.
customer_reviews.author: Zoenje

customer_reviews.title: Great portable, rechargable weather radio!
customer_reviews.text: This weather radio is pretty awesome. It can charge by solar, hand crank, or plugging it in. It has a flashlight, can charge a device via a USB plug, and most important it's a radio. I was concerned about the radio having a rechargeable battery, but after receiving this item, I realized that it is replaceable. It looks like one of the old school portable house telephone batteries (you know, from the early 2000's). I realized I needed this after a hurricane moved through FL this year, and all the radios in my house needed to be plugged in. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Irma tested and approved.
customer_reviews.text: This was the last item I bought for my hurricane kit. A week later Irma hit us. When the power went out I turned this bad boy on and stayed informed. The top reading light worked well and it was great on battery, I installed some ssa's but didn't need to use them, the internal battery did the job. Got about 8 hours of use out of it and it still had charge. Cell service was crap the first 24hrs after the storm and no power meant this was the only information source we had.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Great little emergency radios!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a total of 5 of these emergency radios for Christmas presents. I opened and tested each one of them before I wrapped them and they all worked well. The radio reception is really good - I was surprised! The lights also worked well and I like the multiple ways of powering the radio: AA batteries, solar, crank, and USB (for which they included a cord). I also bought a wall charger for each of them to plug the USB cord into. I want to buy one of these radios for myself eventually. They are definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen R. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after hurricane Matthew in hopes to be ready for the next (Irma is here on Sunday). Excited to put the NOAA updates to the rest, crystal clear sound on FM but TOTAL AWFUL FUZZ on WB, the area it's most needed. I have enough flashlights and charging power for my cellphone but this cheaply made antennae which feels like it will come off at any minute feels like something out of 1972. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Snell

customer_reviews.title: Small Size Big Value
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened the box and saw how small it was I was a little annoyed. Then I quickly realized that it does everything the big boys do and it is compact and easy for travel. After hurricane Irma this item was a must. Our only connection to the outside world with out any power was listening to a neighbors radio for updates on boil water advisories, Red Cross updates, FEMA updates, etc... It is worth every penny. Great little radio with weather band, solar and hand crank. Also takes AAA batteries and has a built in rechargeable battery too.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive flashlight, no radio
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to serve as an emergency radio for hurricane season. Worked well immediately out of the box during initial tests with no problems. After charging the Li-Ion battery, tested again, and the radio no longer works. Now its kind of just an expensive solar-/crank- flashlight. Very disappointing. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Wish we would have had them last month when the power went out. That is really why I bought it...we had no way of finding out why the power was out and wanted to see if it was on the news. This radio does a lot, and works just as described. Am looking forward to using it in our Airstream when we go boondocking!!!
customer_reviews.author: Radjahmoon

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Reception, Small Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I tested this after making sure the battery was fully charged. Either the product was defective or the antenna was so small it didn't get any good reception with it. I couldn't tune in the NOAA station, and the local FM station was so-so. I did like the two different lights and the SOS alarm on it, but without a working radio just wasn't worth it. Plus it didn't offer much range on volume for the radio, low to medium. The alarm part was loud though.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Really does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It has a dial tuner, which is slightly annoying given how small it is, but it works really well. I kept finding new features when I started playing with it; it does basically everything I could want from a small electronic survival device. Except for lighting things on fire, but I have a plasma arc lighter for that. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Blanks

customer_reviews.title: I’m an amateur radio operator & a storm spotter. ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m an amateur radio operator & a storm spotter. I went through the EF5 in Joplin. This product did not work. No radio. First review I’ve done. please don’t sell defective emergency equipment .
customer_reviews.author: Craig Maxey

customer_reviews.title: Quit after Two Days :(
customer_reviews.text: Bought awhile back for emergencies - used first time for Hurricane Irma and the radio for worked for two days and it charged one phone and then quit :( It said to email company to find out how to get a refund and their inbox is full !!!!! So, now I don't know what to do because it is out of Amazon's replacement period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: RunningSnail Solar Crank NOAA Weather Radio for Emergency with AM/FM, Flashlight, Reading Lamp and 2000mAh Power Bank (Green)
feature_bullets: A Must For Emergency: Keep your household prepared with this AM/FM & NOAA weather alert radio, broadcast emergency weather alerts for your area such as hurricanes, tornadoes and severe storms.
Table Lamp & 1W LED Flashlight: It can be used in emergency and survival situations to light up dark spaces and areas or to keep your room nice and bright after a storm cuts off your power.
Hand Crank Self-charge for Outage: 2000mAh rechargeable battery provides up to 12 hours of light or 4-6 hours of radio time.
SOS Alarm With Flashing Red Light: Ask for help in case you have an emergency or you want to warn somebody.
Multiple Ways to Charge: Hand crank, solar charging, Micro USB cable and 3 AAA batteries(not included). It can be charge USB port devices such as smart phones, to keep you connected and powered.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,390 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
